meanings.definition: A small tuft or clump of grass or vegetation.
meanings.sent1: I found a tussehs of grass in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The tussehs of flowers added color to the field.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel made a cozy nest using a tussehs of leaves.
meanings.sent4: Her hair was a tussehs of curls bouncing in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The tussehs of moss on the rock looked like a tiny green pillow.

meanings.definition: A small bundle or cluster of items.
meanings.sent1: She carried a tussehs of sticks for the campfire.
meanings.sent2: The gift was wrapped in a tussehs of colorful ribbons.
meanings.sent3: The toddler's toys were scattered in a tussehs around the room.
meanings.sent4: The necklace was a tussehs of sparkling gems around her neck.
meanings.sent5: The market vendor sold a tussehs of fresh vegetables to the customers.

meanings.definition: To gather or collect into a small bundle or cluster.
meanings.sent1: I will tussehs the papers together before filing them.
meanings.sent2: She tussehsed her hair into a neat bun for the party.
meanings.sent3: The kids decided to tussehs their toys in one corner of the room.
